list_definition.definition: (also adjective) (of) its colour/color, a light yellowish brown
(with upon) to be too humble or to flatter (someone) in a servile way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The courtiers fawned upon the queen.

list_definition.definition: (of dogs) to show affection (by wagging the tail, rolling over etc).

list_ex_of_english: I thought fawn colour was called mauve.
He fawns upon them and makes them believe they are intelligent, when he knows that it is ignorance which is moving them.
They are fawn with small lateral dots on each side.
A red deer fawn lies down and keeps absolutely still and will not be found unless the wolf actually treads on it.
They will fawn all over him and act all touchy-feely-cuddly.
The short, smooth coat is a light grey to fawn colour, fading quickly to white on the undersides and legs.
I represent, for a time at any rate, a city which has had a great record as the forerunner of regional fawn planning.
The hindwings are brownish fawn, with paler veins.
